resources.string: Hexiano, copyright Â© 2011, 2012 by David A. Randolph, 2012 by James Haigh, copyleft 2013 Skriptico, copyleft 2013 Stephen Larroque.

Hexiano is an Open-source isomorphic musical keyboard. All intervals, chords, and scales have identical patterns, regardless of the key in which one plays. Hexiano aims to deliver the isomorphic keyboard concept to Android users. See http://www.altkeyboards.com/ for more information about these instruments.
Source code for Hexiano is available at https://github.com/lrq3000/hexiano (James original Hexiano is at https://gitorious.org/hexiano) under the terms of GNU General Public License (version 3).

This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. For the complete license, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/.

Sounds from the acoustic grand piano soundfont (Yamaha Disklavier Pro), release 2008-09-10, by Roberto Gordo Saez (roberto.gordo@gmail.com), were adapted for use in Hexiano. (See http://zenvoid.org/audio.html.) Specifically, we translated a set of files (mostly from the third velocity layer) from the soundfont into Ogg Vorbis format, with a rather drastic loss of fidelity. Please do not take the Hexiano piano sound as representative of the quality of this excellent soundfont. It just helped to start from a high-quality source.
This soundfont was built using the Zenph Studios Yamaha Disklavier Pro Piano Multisamples for OLPC, which was created by Dr. Mikhail Krishtal, Director of Music Research and Production, and his team at Zenph Studios.
Neither Dr. Krishtal nor Mr. Saez in any way endorses Hexiano. Their work is used under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 license. See http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 for details.

----
Java OSC Library provided by Illposed Software: http://www.illposed.com/software/javaosc.html 
Great thanks to Ahmet Kizilay for freeing the source of his app QuickOsc, which provided inspiration for the OSC/MIDI feature: https://github.com/artsince/QuickOSC 

None of the guys mentioned above endorses Hexiano in any way.
Horizontal keys "point up and down"; vertical keys "point left and right."
Do you want to play looking at a landscape (wide) display?
Number of rows of whole-step keys to include for each octave.
The lowest playable note to include.
The octave of the lowest playable note to include.
The highest playable note to include.
The octave of the highest note to include.
Play adjacent notes with one finger (4ths and 5ths).
What note arrangement on the keys do you want to use?
What colours do you want to see?
What labels do you want to see on the keys?
Enter percentage to scale keys. Default=100. Smaller numbers shrink keys. Larger numbers expand them.
Enter percentage to scale touch surface. Default=100. Below creates gap between keys (enhance precision), above creates note overlap (trigger chords with 1 touch).
Hide all modifier keys (replaced by notes, useful for small screens)
Hold sustain modifier when pressed until pressed again.
Play notes louder when you press harder on the screen. Also works while swiping. Note: may not work on all phones.
Absolute range = 0–127, relative range = min midi note velocity – max midi note velocity (change for each note!)
Enter percentage to boost velocity. 0 disables boosting, higher boost volume of velocity by this percentage.
What sounds do you want to hear?
Use multiple instruments mapped on different keys/rows/columns
Choose keys that will play this instrument (Key/Column/Row separated by comma, eg: K17–19 or C1–3 or R1–2)
Use layout base note and octave
Use the same base note and octave as the whole layout (skip the two next settings)
Priority of this instrument (will overwrite keys notes of other lower ID instruments)
Max number of concurrent sounds (warning: high value may induce jitter!)
Do not load sounds for notes that are not visible (optimize memory, critical for multi instruments)
Error: no sound files could be found for this instrument. Check that they have the correct format (anything_mxxvyy.ext where xx is midi note number and yy velocity)
Error: Cannot load the first sound for any instrument! Please check your multi-instruments settings!
Warning: some extrapolated notes may not work (having a rate below 0.5 and above 2.0). Please add at least one sample sound per octave.
Warning: some extrapolated notes may not work (having a rate below 0.5). Please add at least one sample sound per octave.
Warning: some extrapolated notes may not work (having a rate above 2.0). Please add at least one sample sound per octave.
